name: AI4ALL at Stanford University
description: Intensive 2-week residential AI summer program at Stanford. Learn machine learning fundamentals, neural networks, computer vision, and NLP. Hands-on projects with real-world datasets. Mentorship from Stanford faculty and graduate students. Explore AI ethics and societal impact. Build AI applications for social good. Campus housing and meals included. Focus on increasing diversity in AI.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Machine Learning

name: AI4ALL at UC Berkeley
description: Two-week immersive AI program at UC Berkeley. Introduction to machine learning, deep learning, and AI applications. Work alongside Berkeley researchers and PhD students. Project-based learning with real datasets. Explore AI for social impact. Learn responsible AI development. College preparation and career guidance. On-campus housing at UC Berkeley. Generous financial aid including travel stipends.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Science

name: AI4ALL at Boston University
description: Residential AI summer program at Boston University. Fundamentals of artificial intelligence and machine learning. Python programming and data analysis. Work on team projects solving real-world challenges. Mentorship from BU faculty and industry professionals. Explore Boston tech scene. College readiness workshops. Financial aid covers tuition, housing, meals, and materials.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Data Analysis

name: AI4ALL at University of Michigan
description: Two-week residential AI program at University of Michigan. Introduction to machine learning, neural networks, and AI ethics. Hands-on projects with Michigan faculty. Explore AI applications in healthcare, environment, and education. Learn Python and ML frameworks. Campus life experience at top university. Support from diverse AI community. Full scholarships available covering all program costs.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Ethics

name: AI4ALL at Columbia University
description: Two-week residential program at Columbia in New York City. Introduction to AI, machine learning, and data science. Work with Columbia faculty and researchers. Explore AI applications in urban challenges, healthcare, and media. Tours of NYC tech companies. Networking with Columbia students and alumni. Housing in NYC. Generous financial aid including travel to New York.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Urban Technology

name: AI4ALL Online Programs
description: Virtual AI summer programs for students unable to travel to campus programs. Live online instruction from university faculty. Interactive coding workshops and group projects. Learn Python, machine learning, and AI ethics. Virtual mentorship from AI professionals. Flexible schedule for different time zones. Completely free with no hidden costs. Accessible to students worldwide. Great alternative to residential programs.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Science

name: Bold.org - First-Generation STEM Scholars
description: $1,000-$7,500 scholarship for first-generation college students pursuing any STEM degree. Open to students whose parents did not complete four-year college degree. Essay about challenges of being first-generation student and commitment to STEM education. Minimum 2.5 GPA required. Priority for students from underrepresented minorities and low-income families. Renewable with reapplication.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Explore Machine Learning
description: Introduction to machine learning and artificial intelligence for middle and high school students. Hands-on activities exploring ML concepts, ethics, and applications. Uses Teachable Machine and other accessible tools. No coding experience required. Includes teacher guides and student activities.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning

name: MITES Application Workshops
description: Free workshops helping students prepare strong MITES applications. Cover essay writing, recommendation letters, showcasing STEM interests, and understanding eligibility. Offered virtually and in-person in select cities. Particularly supports first-generation college students and students from underrepresented backgrounds.
stem_fields: Engineering, Science, Technology, Mathematics

name: Scholly - First-Generation STEM Scholars
description: $1,000-$5,000 scholarship for first-generation college students pursuing STEM degrees. Open to students whose parents did not complete four-year college degree. Essay about challenges of being first-generation and commitment to STEM. Minimum 2.5 GPA. Priority for students from underrepresented minorities and low-income families.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: UCONN Mentor Connection High School Research Program
description: Academic year research mentorship program connecting high school students with university faculty. Students design and conduct independent research projects.
stem_fields: General STEM, Biology, Chemistry, Engineering

name: Clark Scholars Program at Texas Tech
description: Seven-week intensive research program where high school students work one-on-one with faculty mentors on original research projects across STEM disciplines.
stem_fields: General STEM, Biology, Chemistry, Engineering, Physics

name: Fermilab TARGET - Teachers and Researchers Generating Excitement for Technology
description: Two-week summer program introducing high school students to particle physics through hands-on activities, lectures, and lab tours at Fermilab.
stem_fields: Physics, Engineering, Computer Science

name: Pioneer Academics - Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
description: Research track exploring artificial intelligence, machine learning algorithms, and neural networks. Work with professor specializing in AI to develop original research project. Topics may include computer vision, natural language processing, reinforcement learning, or AI ethics. Implement machine learning models and analyze results. Learn Python programming and AI frameworks. Research applications of AI to real-world problems. Produce scholarly paper suitable for publication or competition submission.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Neural Networks, Data Science

name: Pioneer Academics - Biotechnology and Genetic Engineering
description: Research in cutting-edge biotechnology including CRISPR, gene therapy, and synthetic biology. Mentored by professor with expertise in molecular biology and genetics. Design theoretical or computational research project exploring genetic engineering applications. Study bioethics and societal implications of biotechnology. Research topics may include disease treatment, agricultural applications, or biomanufacturing. Analyze genomic data and biological systems. Write comprehensive research paper on original findings.
stem_fields: Biotechnology, Genetics, CRISPR, Molecular Biology, Bioengineering

name: Pioneer Academics - Neuroscience and Cognitive Science
description: Research exploring brain function, cognition, and behavior. Work with neuroscience professor on topics like neural circuits, memory, consciousness, or neurological disorders. Study intersection of biology, psychology, and computational neuroscience. Research methods may include literature review, data analysis, or computational modeling. Investigate questions about learning, decision-making, or brain plasticity. Develop deep understanding of neuroscience research methods and current frontiers.
stem_fields: Neuroscience, Cognitive Science, Psychology, Biology, Brain Research

name: Pioneer Academics - Astrophysics and Cosmology
description: Research in astrophysics, cosmology, and space science. Work with astronomy professor on topics like exoplanets, black holes, dark matter, or the early universe. Analyze astronomical data, study theoretical physics, or explore observational techniques. Research questions about stellar evolution, galaxy formation, or fundamental physics. Learn computational methods for astrophysics. Produce research paper contributing to understanding of the cosmos.
stem_fields: Astrophysics, Astronomy, Cosmology, Physics, Space Science

name: Pioneer Academics - Computer Science and Algorithms
description: Research in theoretical or applied computer science. Work with CS professor on algorithms, complexity theory, cryptography, or software engineering. Design and analyze algorithms, explore computational theory, or develop applications. Research may involve coding implementations, mathematical proofs, or system design. Topics can include graph theory, optimization, parallel computing, or computational biology. Build strong foundation in computer science research methodology.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Algorithms, Programming, Software Engineering, Theoretical CS

name: Pioneer Academics - Mathematics and Number Theory
description: Research in pure or applied mathematics. Work with mathematics professor on topics like number theory, combinatorics, topology, or mathematical modeling. Explore theoretical questions or applications of mathematics to other fields. Research may involve proving theorems, analyzing mathematical structures, or developing models. Study connections between different areas of mathematics. Develop mathematical reasoning and proof-writing skills. Produce rigorous mathematical research paper.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Number Theory, Pure Math, Applied Math, Mathematical Modeling

name: Pioneer Academics - Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
description: Research in biochemistry exploring protein structure, enzyme function, or metabolic pathways. Work with biochemistry professor on topics like drug discovery, structural biology, or cellular processes. Study molecular mechanisms of life at atomic and molecular scales. Research may involve computational analysis, literature review, or theoretical modeling. Topics can include protein folding, signal transduction, or gene regulation. Develop understanding of modern biochemistry research.
stem_fields: Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Protein Science, Cell Biology, Enzymology

name: Pioneer Academics - Physics and Quantum Mechanics
description: Research in theoretical or experimental physics. Work with physics professor on topics like quantum mechanics, particle physics, condensed matter, or thermodynamics. Explore fundamental questions about nature of reality and physical laws. Research may involve mathematical analysis, computational simulations, or thought experiments. Topics can include quantum computing, relativity, superconductivity, or statistical mechanics. Develop deep understanding of physics principles and research methods.
stem_fields: Physics, Quantum Mechanics, Theoretical Physics, Particle Physics, Condensed Matter

name: Pioneer Academics - Chemistry and Materials Science
description: Research in organic, inorganic, physical chemistry, or materials science. Work with chemistry professor on topics like chemical synthesis, reaction mechanisms, or novel materials. Study catalysis, nanomaterials, polymers, or drug design. Research may involve computational chemistry, literature analysis, or theoretical modeling. Topics can include sustainable chemistry, battery technology, or medicinal chemistry. Develop understanding of chemical principles and research methodology.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Nanotechnology, Organic Chemistry

name: Pioneer Academics - Engineering and Robotics
description: Research in mechanical, electrical, or computer engineering. Work with engineering professor on topics like robotics, control systems, or engineering design. Study automation, sensor systems, or mechatronics. Research may involve design projects, simulations, or optimization problems. Topics can include autonomous vehicles, renewable energy systems, or biomedical devices. Develop engineering problem-solving and design thinking skills.
stem_fields: Engineering, Robotics, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Design

name: Pioneer Academics - Data Science and Statistics
description: Research in data science, statistical analysis, or machine learning applications. Work with data science professor on topics like predictive modeling, big data analytics, or statistical inference. Study data visualization, experimental design, or causal inference. Research may involve analyzing real-world datasets or developing new statistical methods. Topics can include sports analytics, healthcare data, or social network analysis. Learn R, Python, and statistical software.
stem_fields: Data Science, Statistics, Analytics, Machine Learning, Quantitative Analysis

name: Pioneer Academics - Biomedical Science and Medicine
description: Research in biomedical sciences exploring disease mechanisms, treatments, or medical technology. Work with medical school professor on topics like cancer biology, immunology, or drug development. Study pathophysiology, clinical research, or public health. Research may involve literature analysis, data mining, or theoretical modeling. Topics can include personalized medicine, vaccine development, or regenerative medicine. Explore career paths in medicine and biomedical research.
stem_fields: Biomedical Science, Medicine, Immunology, Pathology, Clinical Research

name: Pioneer Academics - Economics and Game Theory
description: Research in economics, game theory, or behavioral economics. Work with economics professor on topics like market dynamics, strategic decision-making, or economic modeling. Study microeconomics, macroeconomics, or econometrics. Research may involve mathematical modeling, data analysis, or theoretical exploration. Topics can include auction theory, mechanism design, financial markets, or development economics. Develop quantitative economic analysis skills.
stem_fields: Economics, Game Theory, Mathematics, Behavioral Economics, Quantitative Analysis

name: Pioneer Academics - Public Health and Epidemiology
description: Research in public health addressing disease prevention, health policy, or epidemiology. Work with public health professor on topics like infectious diseases, health disparities, or healthcare systems. Study statistical analysis of health data, disease modeling, or intervention evaluation. Research may explore social determinants of health, vaccine efficacy, or health communication. Topics can include pandemic response, health equity, or global health challenges.
stem_fields: Public Health, Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Health Policy, Disease Prevention

name: Pioneer Academics - Applied Mathematics and Optimization
description: Research in applied mathematics focusing on optimization, operations research, or mathematical modeling. Work with professor on topics like linear programming, network flows, or algorithm optimization. Study applications of mathematics to real-world problems in logistics, finance, or engineering. Research may involve developing models, proving optimality, or computational implementations. Topics can include combinatorial optimization, stochastic processes, or numerical methods.
stem_fields: Applied Mathematics, Optimization, Operations Research, Mathematical Modeling, Algorithms

name: Stanford University Mathematics Camp (SUMaC)
description: Intensive four-week residential program for grades 10-11 in advanced mathematics. Focus on abstract mathematical thinking, proofs, and problem-solving. Two tracks: Program I (algebra and number theory) and Program II (topology and group theory). Taught by Stanford faculty and graduate students. Highly selective.
stem_fields: Mathematics

name: Stanford University-Level Online Math & Physics
description: Advanced online courses offering Stanford University credit in mathematics and physics. College-level curriculum taught by Stanford instructors. Self-paced with regular assignments and exams. Covers topics like multivariable calculus, linear algebra, and advanced physics. Requires strong mathematical background.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Physics

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Computer Science
description: Three-week intensive computer science program covering programming, algorithms, data structures, and software development. Hands-on coding projects using Python, Java, or other languages. Learn from Stanford CS faculty and graduate students. Build portfolio projects. Residential experience includes tech talks and company visits.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Software Engineering

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Engineering
description: Engineering design and problem-solving program introducing students to various engineering disciplines. Includes mechanical, electrical, biomedical, and computer engineering projects. Team-based design challenges, lab work, and prototype building. Meet Stanford engineering faculty and tour engineering labs.
stem_fields: Engineering, Design, Technology

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Artificial Intelligence
description: Advanced AI and machine learning program covering neural networks, computer vision, natural language processing, and AI ethics. Programming projects using Python and ML frameworks. Learn from Stanford AI researchers. Explore AI applications and future implications. Requires programming background.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Machine Learning

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Biomedical Sciences
description: Exploration of biomedical research, biotechnology, and medical sciences. Laboratory techniques, research methods, and ethical issues in biomedicine. Visit Stanford medical facilities and research labs. Learn from medical faculty and researchers. Covers genetics, cell biology, and biomedical engineering.
stem_fields: Biomedical Science, Biology, Medicine

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Physics
description: Advanced physics topics beyond high school curriculum including modern physics, quantum mechanics, and relativity. Laboratory experiments, problem-solving, and mathematical modeling. Taught by Stanford physics faculty. Prepares students for university-level physics. Requires strong math background.
stem_fields: Physics, Mathematics

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Data Science
description: Introduction to data science covering statistics, data analysis, visualization, and machine learning applications. Work with real datasets, learn Python and R, and develop data-driven projects. Includes statistical thinking, data ethics, and communication of findings. No prior programming required.
stem_fields: Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Game Design
description: Game design and development program combining programming, art, storytelling, and game mechanics. Create original video games using industry tools. Learn game engines, 3D modeling, level design, and game theory. Team projects and portfolio development. Suitable for aspiring game developers.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Game Development, Design

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Robotics
description: Hands-on robotics program covering robot design, programming, sensors, and autonomous systems. Build and program robots for competitions and challenges. Learn mechanical design, electronics, and control systems. Team-based projects with industry-standard robotics platforms. Tour Stanford robotics labs.
stem_fields: Robotics, Engineering, Computer Science

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Environmental Science
description: Study environmental challenges, sustainability, and climate science. Field work, laboratory research, and data analysis. Explore Stanford sustainability initiatives and environmental research. Topics include ecology, conservation, renewable energy, and environmental policy. Scientific research skills development.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Biology, Chemistry

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Chemistry
description: Advanced chemistry covering topics beyond AP level including organic chemistry, chemical synthesis, and spectroscopy. Laboratory-intensive program with research-style experiments. Learn modern chemical techniques and instrumentation. Taught by Stanford chemistry faculty. Prepares for college chemistry.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Science

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Business & Entrepreneurship
description: Introduction to business principles, entrepreneurship, and innovation. Develop business plans, learn marketing and finance basics, and pitch startup ideas. Guest speakers from Silicon Valley. Team projects simulating real business challenges. Includes visits to Stanford business school and local companies.
stem_fields: Business, Entrepreneurship, Technology

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Biochemistry at Indiana University
description: 39-day residential research program for rising 10th and 11th graders at Indiana University Bloomington. Students explore frontiers of biochemistry through hands-on research and coursework. Study protein biochemistry, enzyme mechanisms, and metabolic pathways. Laboratory techniques including chromatography, spectrometry, and bioinformatics analysis. Team-based research projects addressing real scientific questions. Individual components allowing personal research interests. Scientific writing and presentation skills development. Access to IU research facilities and faculty mentorship. Immersive residential experience with diverse cohort of science-minded students.
stem_fields: Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, Laboratory Techniques, Enzymology

name: BYJU'S Future School - Coding for Beginners (Ages 6-8)
description: Introduction to coding through visual programming and storytelling. One-on-one live classes teaching Scratch basics, game creation, and logical thinking. Build first coding projects with personalized teacher guidance.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Coding, Programming, Scratch

name: BYJU'S Future School - Free Trial Classes
description: Free trial classes to experience one-on-one learning approach. Sample coding or math class with certified teacher. No commitment required to try platform.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Mathematics, Trial Program

name: CS Scholars
description: Comprehensive computer science program for high school students. Learn programming, algorithms, data structures, and software development from CMU faculty. Work on real-world projects and collaborate with peers. Includes exposure to CMU School of Computer Science research. Residential summer experience.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Software Engineering

name: National High School Game Academy
description: Game design and development program combining art, programming, and storytelling. Students create original video games working in teams. Learn game engines, 3D modeling, animation, and game design principles. Taught by CMU Entertainment Technology Center faculty. Portfolio-building opportunity.
stem_fields: Game Development, Computer Science, Design, Programming

name: Summer Academy for Math and Science
description: Rigorous STEM program covering advanced mathematics and science topics. Students engage in problem-solving, research projects, and mathematical exploration. Learn from CMU faculty and graduate students. Includes laboratory work and computational methods. Prepares students for STEM majors.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Science, Physics, Chemistry

name: Architecture Program
description: Intensive architecture and design program introducing students to architectural thinking and practice. Learn design principles, technical drawing, 3D modeling, and sustainable design. Work on design projects and visit Pittsburgh architecture sites. Studio-based learning with CMU School of Architecture faculty.
stem_fields: Architecture, Design, Engineering

name: Design Program
description: Explore communication design, product design, and environmental design. Learn design thinking methodology, prototyping, user research, and visual communication. Work on real design challenges and build portfolio. Taught by CMU School of Design faculty. Includes workshops and studio projects.
stem_fields: Design, UX Design, Product Design, Visual Communication

name: Summer Session
description: Take actual Carnegie Mellon undergraduate courses for college credit. Choose from variety of STEM and humanities courses. Experience university-level academics and campus life. Earn transferable college credits. Live on campus with other pre-college students.
stem_fields: Various STEM and Liberal Arts

name: Kode With Klossy Virtual Web Development Camp
description: Free 2-week virtual coding camp for girls ages 13-18 teaching HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Build websites and web applications through project-based learning with experienced instructors. Daily live instruction, hands-on coding projects, and peer collaboration. No prior coding experience required.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Web Development, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

name: TEALS Introduction to Computer Science
description: Year-long introductory computer science course bringing industry volunteers into high school classrooms. Learn programming fundamentals, problem-solving, and computational thinking. Microsoft-funded program pairing teachers with tech professionals. No prior CS experience required for students or teachers. Full curriculum and resources provided.
stem_fields: Computer Science

name: TEALS AP Computer Science Principles
description: AP Computer Science Principles course exploring computing foundations, internet, data, algorithms, and societal impacts. Industry mentors team-teach with classroom teachers. Prepares students for AP CS Principles exam. Broader introduction to CS than AP CS A. Focuses on computational thinking and creativity.
stem_fields: Computer Science

name: TEALS Cybersecurity
description: Introduction to cybersecurity fundamentals including network security, cryptography, and ethical hacking. Industry professionals teach alongside classroom teachers. Hands-on labs and real-world scenarios. Learn about careers in cybersecurity. Addresses growing demand for security professionals.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Cybersecurity

name: NCSSM Online - Advanced Sciences
description: Advanced science courses beyond AP level including astrophysics, organic chemistry, molecular biology, and environmental science; virtual labs and simulations; research opportunities; college-level rigor; NCSSM expert faculty.
eligibility: High school students with prerequisite science coursework; NC priority

name: NSBE Jr. - Mentorship Circles
description: Structured mentorship pairing NSBE Jr. members with college students and professional engineers. Monthly virtual or in-person meetings. Academic guidance, career advice, and personal development. Help with college applications and scholarship essays. Exposure to different engineering careers. Long-term relationships building over years. Focus on Black engineering role models. Support navigating challenges as Black student in STEM.
stem_fields: Engineering, Career Development, Academic Support

name: NSBE Jr. - Scholarship and Financial Aid Workshops
description: Workshops helping students and families navigate college funding. Information on NSBE scholarships, STEM scholarships, and general financial aid. Help completing FAFSA and scholarship applications. Essay writing workshops for scholarship applications. Connecting students with scholarship opportunities. Understanding costs of different colleges. Financial literacy for college students. Critical support for families new to college process.
stem_fields: College Preparation, Financial Literacy, Scholarship Applications

name: Polygence Research Academy - Virtual Mentorship
description: One-on-one virtual research mentorship connecting high school students with PhD mentors. Students design and complete independent research projects over 10-16 weeks. Flexible scheduling and broad research topics available.
stem_fields: All Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Social Sciences

name: Polygence - Biotechnology and Life Sciences
description: Research mentorship in biology, biotechnology, and life sciences. Explore topics like genetics, molecular biology, neuroscience, or ecology. Projects may involve computational biology, bioinformatics analysis, or theoretical research. Work with PhD mentors from top biology programs. Topics can include CRISPR applications, disease mechanisms, synthetic biology, or evolutionary studies. Learn biological research methods and scientific thinking. Produce research suitable for science competitions and journals.
stem_fields: Biology, Biotechnology, Genetics, Neuroscience, Life Sciences, Bioinformatics

name: Polygence - Engineering and Design
description: One-on-one mentorship in engineering disciplines and design thinking. Explore mechanical, electrical, chemical, or biomedical engineering. Projects may involve CAD modeling, circuit design, materials analysis, or engineering optimization. Work with engineering professors and industry professionals. Learn design process from problem identification to solution testing. Develop engineering portfolio showcasing technical skills and problem-solving abilities.
stem_fields: Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Design, Problem Solving

name: Polygence - Chemistry and Materials Science
description: One-on-one research in chemistry and materials science. Explore organic chemistry, physical chemistry, or nanotechnology. Projects may involve computational chemistry, materials analysis, or chemical research. Work with chemistry PhD mentors. Topics can include drug design, catalysis, polymer science, or green chemistry. Learn chemical thinking and research methodology. Produce research suitable for chemistry competitions.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Materials Science, Nanotechnology, Chemical Engineering, Organic Chemistry

name: Polygence - Psychology and Cognitive Science
description: Research mentorship in psychology, neuroscience, and cognitive science. Explore behavioral psychology, cognitive processes, or mental health. Projects may involve literature reviews, survey research, or experimental design. Work with psychology PhD mentors. Topics can include memory, decision-making, social psychology, or developmental psychology. Learn psychological research methods and statistical analysis.
stem_fields: Psychology, Cognitive Science, Neuroscience, Behavioral Science, Research Methods

name: MIT RISE - Research in Science and Engineering
description: 7-week summer research program at MIT for underrepresented high school students. Conduct research in engineering, computer science, or life sciences. Work with MIT faculty on authentic research projects. Program completely free including housing, meals, and stipend. Academic enrichment workshops and college preparation sessions. Focus on increasing diversity in STEM research. Strong preference for students from underrepresented minorities, women, first-generation college students, and low-income backgrounds. Minimum 3.0 GPA required.
stem_fields: Engineering, Computer Science, Life Sciences, Research Methods

name: UC Berkeley RISE Research Internship
description: 6-week summer research program at UC Berkeley for California high school students. Conduct research in life sciences, physical sciences, or engineering with Berkeley faculty. Residential option available or commuter. Research project culminating in poster presentation. College credit offered. Financial aid available for students with demonstrated need. Focus on preparing students for college-level research. Laboratory safety training and research ethics workshops included.
stem_fields: Life Sciences, Physical Sciences, Engineering, Environmental Science

name: Carnegie Mellon RISE Computer Science Research
description: 7-week summer research program focusing on computer science and robotics at Carnegie Mellon University. High school students work on AI, machine learning, human-computer interaction, or robotics projects. Mentored by CMU faculty and PhD students. Residential program with housing and meals. Weekly tech talks and professional development. Produce working prototype or research paper. Program fee with need-based scholarships available. Preference for women and underrepresented minorities in CS.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Robotics, Human-Computer Interaction

name: Columbia RISE Biomedical Research
description: 8-week summer biomedical research program at Columbia University Medical Center for NYC-area high school students. Work in medical research laboratories studying disease mechanisms, drug development, or public health. Mentored by Columbia faculty and medical students. Commuter program with stipend. Weekly seminars on careers in medicine and research. Hospital tours and clinical exposure. Focus on students from underserved communities. Minimum 3.0 GPA in science courses.
stem_fields: Biomedical Research, Medicine, Drug Development, Public Health, Clinical Research

name: University of Washington RISE Engineering Research
description: 6-week engineering research program for Pacific Northwest high school students. Conduct research in mechanical, electrical, civil, or biomedical engineering at UW. Faculty-mentored projects addressing real-world engineering challenges. Mix of residential and commuter options. Weekly design workshops and professional development. Build engineering portfolio. Financial aid available. Emphasis on recruiting women and minorities into engineering fields.
stem_fields: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Biomedical Engineering

name: University of Michigan RISE Research Fellows
description: 7-week summer research fellowship at University of Michigan for Midwest high school students. Research in natural sciences, engineering, or mathematics. Close mentorship from U-M faculty and graduate students. Residential program with housing and meals. Weekly research seminars and career panels. Develop research proposal, conduct experiments, and present findings. Need-based financial aid available. Focus on students from rural and underserved urban areas.
stem_fields: Natural Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics, Research Methods

name: Georgia Tech RISE Engineering and Computing
description: 6-week summer research program at Georgia Institute of Technology for high school students interested in engineering and computer science. Work on research projects in robotics, cybersecurity, materials science, or sustainable engineering. Faculty mentorship and hands-on laboratory work. Residential program in Atlanta. College credit option. Financial aid available for Georgia residents and students with demonstrated need. Team-based and individual research projects.
stem_fields: Engineering, Computer Science, Robotics, Cybersecurity, Materials Science

name: Northwestern RISE Materials Science Research
description: 7-week summer research program at Northwestern University focusing on materials science and nanotechnology. High school students work in cutting-edge research facilities on nanomaterials, polymers, or energy materials. Mentored by materials science faculty. Residential program in Evanston, IL. Clean room and advanced microscopy training. Research presentation at end of program. Competitive admissions. Financial aid available based on need.
stem_fields: Materials Science, Nanotechnology, Polymers, Energy Materials, Chemistry

name: Duke RISE Environmental Science Research
description: 6-week environmental science research program at Duke University for rising high school seniors. Conduct field and laboratory research on climate change, ecology, or environmental policy. Work with Duke faculty in Nicholas School of Environment. Mix of field work and data analysis. Residential program with housing and meals. Sustainability-focused curriculum. Research project on local or global environmental issue. Need-based scholarships available.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Climate Change, Ecology, Environmental Policy, Sustainability

name: University of Illinois RISE Physics and Astronomy
description: 8-week summer research program in physics and astronomy at University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. High school students conduct research using observatory facilities or physics laboratories. Projects in astrophysics, particle physics, or condensed matter physics. Mentored by physics faculty and graduate students. Residential program. Weekly colloquia and lab tours. Produce research paper or poster. Financial aid available for Illinois residents.
stem_fields: Physics, Astronomy, Astrophysics, Particle Physics, Observatory Research

name: Johns Hopkins RISE Neuroscience Research
description: 7-week neuroscience research program at Johns Hopkins University for high school students passionate about brain science. Work in neuroscience laboratories studying cognition, behavior, or neurological diseases. Mentored by Johns Hopkins faculty and medical students. Residential program in Baltimore. Hospital and lab tours. Weekly seminars on neuroscience careers and medical school. Research presentation at program end. Need-based financial aid available.
stem_fields: Neuroscience, Brain Science, Cognitive Science, Neurobiology, Medical Research

name: University of Pennsylvania RISE Bioengineering
description: 6-week bioengineering research program at UPenn for high school students interested in medical devices, tissue engineering, or computational biology. Work in Penn bioengineering laboratories on cutting-edge projects. Faculty mentorship and graduate student collaboration. Residential program in Philadelphia. Engineering design workshops and medical device demonstrations. Research poster at program end. Competitive admissions. Financial aid available.
stem_fields: Bioengineering, Medical Devices, Tissue Engineering, Computational Biology

name: Rice University RISE Research Experience
description: 7-week summer research program at Rice University for Texas and Louisiana high school students. Research in physical sciences, life sciences, or engineering. Small cohort with individualized mentorship from Rice faculty. Residential program in Houston. Weekly workshops on scientific writing, presentations, and college applications. Research symposium showcasing student work. Need-based financial aid reducing program costs. Focus on recruiting diverse student body.
stem_fields: Physical Sciences, Life Sciences, Engineering, Research Methods

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Robotics Engineering 2
description: Advanced robotics engineering with kinematics, dynamics, path planning, and computer vision. Design complex autonomous systems. Prepares students for collegiate-level robotics.
stem_fields: Robotics, Advanced Engineering, Computer Vision, Kinematics

name: Broadcom MASTERS Competition
description: Premier national STEM competition for middle school students grades 6-8. Top 30 finalists compete in Washington DC for scholarships and awards. Must qualify through affiliated science fair.
stem_fields: Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, All STEM

name: Broadcom MASTERS - Finals Competition
description: Top 30 finalists travel to Washington DC for week-long STEM competition. Team and individual challenges testing critical thinking, collaboration, communication, and creativity. $25,000 top prize.
stem_fields: STEM, Problem Solving, Critical Thinking

name: Broadcom MASTERS - Samueli Foundation Prize
description: Special award for engineering projects in MASTERS competition. Recognizes outstanding middle school engineering research. Additional prize and recognition for finalists.
stem_fields: Engineering, Design, Technology

name: Broadcom MASTERS - Application Process
description: Online application for nominated students. Submit essays, video, and science fair project documentation. Selection based on research, communication skills, and STEM passion.
stem_fields: STEM, Communication, Research

name: Garcia Research Scholars - Academic Year Extension
description: Continuation of summer research during academic year for Garcia Scholars. Students continue working with faculty mentors part-time while attending high school. Develop research further, prepare for competitions, and work toward publications. Monthly seminars and research group meetings. Flexible scheduling around school commitments. Strengthen college applications with sustained research experience.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering

name: Garcia Research Scholars - Biology and Life Sciences Track
description: Research opportunities in molecular biology, genetics, neuroscience, ecology, or biomedical sciences. Work in university laboratories using advanced equipment and techniques. Learn experimental design, microscopy, data analysis, and scientific communication. Projects may include studying gene expression, animal behavior, cellular processes, or disease mechanisms. Mentored by biology faculty.
stem_fields: Biology, Molecular Biology, Genetics, Neuroscience, Ecology

name: Garcia Research Scholars - Research Symposium and Competitions
description: End-of-summer research symposium where Garcia Scholars present findings to faculty, peers, and families. Develop scientific posters and oral presentations. Support for entering research competitions including Intel ISEF, Regeneron STS, and regional science fairs. Guidance on abstracts, presentations, and competition applications.
stem_fields: Scientific Communication, Research Presentation, Competition Preparation

name: Garcia Research Scholars - College Application Support
description: Guidance leveraging Garcia research experience for college applications. Help framing research in personal statements, supplemental essays, and activity lists. Recommendation letters from faculty mentors. Support applying to selective universities and STEM programs. Resume building and interview preparation.
stem_fields: College Preparation, Career Guidance, Academic Advising

name: Tynker Summer Coding Camp - Mobile Apps
description: Design and develop mobile applications in this week-long intensive camp. Learn UI design, app logic, and deployment with experienced instructors.
stem_fields: Mobile Development, Computer Science, App Design

name: USABO School Registration
description: High schools register to participate in USABO competition. Registration includes access to all exam materials and resources. Schools coordinate local administration of Open Exam. Teacher training materials and guidelines provided. Registration fee covers exam materials for unlimited students.
stem_fields: Biology, Life Sciences

name: USABO Study Groups and Preparation Courses
description: Student-organized and teacher-led study groups for USABO preparation. Regular meetings to review biology topics, practice problems, and mock exams. Peer learning and collaborative study. Many schools offer after-school preparation courses. Community of biology enthusiasts supporting each other.
stem_fields: Biology, Life Sciences
